thesis.description: About six hundred feet north-west from the margin of the intrusive mass of Mount Royal, as exposed in the Corporatioln (Forsythe) Quarry, rises a small hummock known locally as Mount Royal Heights. [...] It is underlain, for the most part, by an igneous breccia composed of fragments of Trenton limestone in a matrix of camptonite. [...] The railway tunnel driven through Mount Royal a few years ago passes beneath this locality. In the section thus exposed it was found that this intrusive had widened to very nearly five hundred feet, and apparently forms a small stock which at no time extended much above the present level of Mount Royal Heights. [...]
thesis.creator: Pelletier, Rene A.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Absorption of inclusions of potsdam sandstone by alkalic magma, Mount Royal Heights, Montreal.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The need of a suitable medium for the routine analysis of milk, and for the growth of the lactic acid group of microorganisms in milk has been of long standing. Since Lactobacillus bulgaricus and Lactobacillus acidophilus have attained such prominence as therapeutic measures, a medium which can be used for their isolation, cultivation, transportation, and storage is essential. [...]
thesis.creator: Perry, Helen Margaret.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology.
Lactic acid bacteria.
thesis.title: Media for the lactic acid group of microorganisms.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: ... few persons are aware of the extent to which the corporate idea enters into their daily lives. [...] ... as instances of private corporations on a large scale are rare in Canada, the public corporation will be treated of most fully in what follows [...]
thesis.creator: Peterson, Frederick O.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: Corporate finance in Canada.

thesis.description: On reproche souvent aux Français de ne pas s'intéresser aux littératures étrangères. Björnstjerne Björnson, par exemple, s'est déclaré très franchement à cet égard : "--Dans notre vieux continent, il y a deux races : l'Europe, les Etats-unis d'Europe, Cosmopolis, si vous voulez, d'une part; et de l'autre, isolée du reste comme par un mur de Chine: la France." [...]
thesis.creator: Reque, A. Dikka.
thesis.subject: French.
thesis.title: La critique franchise et le drame norvegien.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The fact that maple syrup is a highly appreciated product principally because of its delicate flavor, and also becuase of its small annual production, has caused many adulterated maple syrups and substitutes to be placed upon the market. [...] If it were possible to find some method of isolating and identifying the compound responsible for maple flavor, or even to find some color reaction that would be based upon the actual flavoring principle contained in maple products, it would materially increase the ease of detecting adulteration. [...] There have been numerous attempts to determine the composition and structure of the compound or compounds which give the flavor to maple products. [...] So far as I have been able to find, there have been no successful attempts to isolate and identify the maple flavor. [...]
thesis.creator: Robison, S. C.
thesis.subject: Maple syrup.
Agronomy.
thesis.title: The isolation and identification of the flavoring principle in maple syrup.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Sweet clover is a new crop of increasing importance, particularly for special locations, it being very hardy, drought and alkali-resisting, and adaptable to a wide range of soil and climatic conditions. Because of these good qualities more especially, its culture is extending; and a better knowledge of its composition and feed producing ability as affected by the time of cutting is desirable. [...]
thesis.creator: Rogers, John T.
thesis.subject: Sweet clover.
Agronomy.
thesis.title: The relative yield and value of sweet clover under different methods of treatment.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Among the fungi, one of themost important groups is that which includes the "anthracnose organisms", that is to say, the Colletotrichums and Gloeosporiums, the Volutellas and Vermicularias with the perfect stages of such of these as are known. As a group it has received considerable attention from the point of view of Morphology, Cytology, Physiology, Taxonomy, Pathogenicity etc. The study reported here was suggested by Dr. B.T. Dickson, Head of the Department of Botany, Macdonald College of McGill University [...]
thesis.creator: Scott, Gordon A.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology -- Cultures and culture media.
Plant Pathology.
Fungi.
thesis.title: Cultural characteristics of certain colletotrichum species.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Pour comprendre le phénomène de l'influence extraordinaire de Shakespeare sur le théâtre d'Alfred de Musset, il est important de savoir un peu l'histoire de cette influence sur le drame français depuis le temps de Shakespeare jusqu'à l'époque de Musset. [...]
thesis.creator: Silver, Edith.
thesis.subject: French.
thesis.title: L'influence de Shakespeare sur le theatre d'Alfred de Musset.

thesis.description: At the present time perhaps more than ever interest in chemical and·physical research is focussed upon the question of the nature and structure of matter. Although the age old problem of chemical affinity has lost much of its mystery in the light of the present day theories of atomic structure, the accumulation of a vast amount of chemical and physical data seems necessary to test these theories or to modify them. [...]
thesis.creator: Sivertz, Christian.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Reaction velocities and molecular compound formation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In 1922, Wo. Oswald put forward the generalisation that, on the average, the swelling of "heavily vulcanised caoutchouc" is inversely proportional to the dielectric constant ... [...] In the present work, raw unextracted rubber and vulcanised rubber of known sulphur content were employed. The purpose of the investigation was to see if Ostwald's generalisation, mentioned above, held for all the liquids obtainable. Also to find the general action of solvents on the rubber. This is becoming commercially important in the manufacture of vapour resisting masks; and also in the experimental work on the precipitation of rubber, most reagents dissolving it and only a few causing precipitation. [...]
thesis.creator: Smith, Frederick M.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Relation between the chemical constitution of organic liquids and their ability to swell certain organic materials: the swelling of rubber.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The commercial application of the solubility of gold in cyanide solution, had its inception in the McArthur-Furrest patent of 1887 [...] Since then the process has spread to every gold and silver mining disrict in the world, with few exceptions, and although not equally successful with every class of ore, it may fairly be claimed that its introduction has revolutionized the metallurgy of the precious metals. Agitation of the ore with cyanide solution was an integral part of the first tests of the feasibillity of the new process; but in commercial application, cyanidation developed into the leaching process, because of the lack of equipment to affect the agitation and filtration. Also grinding was not carried to a point of great fineness and neither was it necessary in view of the fact that most of the pre treated came from the oxidized zone, where the gold was largely "free", and comparatively coarse. [...]
thesis.creator: Snijman, Johan J.
thesis.subject: Ore Dressing.
thesis.title: Coarse grinding versus fine grinding in gold recovery by cyanidation.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is the purpose of this thesis to give a petrographical description of thirty-one of these minor intrusive rocks which occur as 24 dykes and 7 dyke-like sheets in the limestone of the tunnel between the East Portal and station 182-90, a distance or 3,500 feet. It is also purposed to determine so far as possible the relative ages of these intrusives as well as their petrographical and chemical relationship to one another and to the larger intrusions. [...]
thesis.creator: Squires, Henry D.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Dyke rocks of Mount Royal tunnel between East Portal and Station 182-90.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The development of modern physical chemistry has led to a great interest in all the properties of aqueous solutions. Viscosity has received the attention of a great number of physical chemists, among the more prominent being Arrhenius and Ostwald. [...]
thesis.creator: Steacie, Edgar W.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The viscosity of the liquid halogens.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Every bacteriologist will agree that the proof of the spore lies in its resistance. There is abundant evidence on every hand that its resistance to heat and disinfectants is markedly superior to that of the vegetative non-spore bearing stage of the bacillus from which it is developed, or of nonspore bearing bacteria in general. The B.Anthrax spore, commonly but mistakenly regarded as "the most resistant known", is employed as the test par excellence of efficiency of disinfectants. Koch found that the bacillus of B.Anthracis is killed by an exposure to one percent phenol for two minutes but that the spores, subjected to solutions of this strength survive from one to fifteen days. [...]
thesis.creator: Shanly, Eleanor.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology.
thesis.title: On the heat resistance of bacterial spores, with a consideration of the nature of the spore-like bodies seen in B. tuberculosis and allied forms.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Methods of reducing error and obtaining greater accuracy in field plot work have been under consideration by the agronomist for a number of years. Extensive studies of border effect, competition, size and shape of plot, number of replications, different systems of checking, etc., have been made to estimate and reduce the variations in yield due to lack of uniformity in the soil. [...]
thesis.creator: Tinney, Benjamin F.
thesis.subject: Field experiments.
Field crops.
Agronomy.
thesis.title: Methods of experimentation with field crops with special reference to the duration of the experiments.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The sap of the maple tree, while essentially a dilute solution of sucrose, contains in addition small amounts of organic acids and mineral matter. The manufacture of maple syrup and sugar consists simply in the evaporation of a certain proportion of the water contained in the sap. These maple products owe their value to their peculiar agreeable flavor and hence are not subjected to the process of refining employed in the case of cane sugar, as this would result in the elimination of the "maple" flavor and also in the removal of the organic acids and inorganic salts. Accordingly,we find that maple syrup and sugar contain a greater concentration of inorganic salts than does the original maple sap. [...]
thesis.creator: Scott, Joseph Morrow.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: The ash constituents and organic acids of maple products.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Sir Henry Bessemer's paper on "The Manufacture of Malleable Iron & Steel without Fuel", read before the British Association on August 11,1g56,and R. Mnshat's patent of September 221856, for the addition of Manganese to Bessemerized metal, introduced to the World, Steel, as we know it today. Bessemer made steel by blowing air through molten iron and therebyburning out from the latter it's Silicon, Carbon and Manganese, the heat of combustion of these elaments sufficing to maintain the metal in a suitably fluid condition. The process was conducted in an acid lined vessel and no phosphorus was removed. [...]
thesis.creator: Scott, Arthur P.
thesis.subject: Mining Engineering.
thesis.title: On the open hearth process of steel manufacture : an investigation of the relative merits of an interrupted as distinguished from a continuous process.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: During the winter of 1922-23 an investigation was performed at Lachine in the erecting shops of the Dominion Bridge Company the object of which was to study the behaviour of steel I-beams haunched with concrete for the purpose of protecting the steel from fire or corrosion. While such beams have hitherto been designed on the assumption that the entire load, including the weight of the encasing concrete is carried by the steel, it was thought that the steel and concerte might really act together so as to form a composite beam and that it might be practicable to arrive at some rational basis for design analogous to that employed in the case of reinforced concrete T-beams. With this object in view two identical floor panels were built and loaded with structural steel shapes. The report of this investigation may be found in the Journal of the Engineering Institute of Canada, August, 1923. [...]
thesis.creator: Trueman, James C.
thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: Investigation of I-beams haunched with concrete with special reference to bond and sheer.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The following investigation was carried out with a view to determining the feasibility of internal cooling as applied to internal combustion engines. By internal cooling,is meant the injection of water into the cylinder, by means of a mechanically operated valve or nozzle, the several jets striking the cylinder walls, valves, head and piston, and absorbing heat from them. [...]
thesis.creator: Ryan, Charles C.
thesis.subject: Thermodynamics.
thesis.title: Internal cooling applied to a 12 h.p. gas engine.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In 1904 when George Moore set down his dictum upon the death of French Naturalism Vicente Blasco Ibanez was thirty-eight years of age. He had already published eight of his novels, and Spanish critics were beginning to call him, in too summary a fashion perhaps, -- the Spanish Zola. [...]
thesis.creator: Walter, Felix H.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: Vicente Blasco Ibanez and his relation to the French naturalists : a study in comparative literature.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Some physical constants of ferry wire. thesis.description: This thesis has been entitled The Migration of Peoples from Canada to the United States. But if we were to consider the emigration aspect alone we should not be in a position to adequately examine and pronounce upon the situation as a whole. [...]

United States -- Emigration and immigration.

thesis.description: Reasons for studying the subject: The successfull storage of coal in such a manner as to avoid danger from fires, and to lessen the injurious effects of contact with the atmosphere, has been a problem to which much attention has been drawn during recent years. Climatic conditions: Taking Canada for example, where there is no comparison between freight rates by sea and land, transportation of such a bulky commodity as coal, must necessarily be done during the summer months. The industrial demand for fuel is practically constant, yet the coal must be stored at hand to meet this demand throughout at least seven months of the year; this holds also for the railways. The demad for fuel for household use is also greatest during the winter months. [...]
thesis.creator: Billington, Edward E.
thesis.subject: Mining Engineering.
thesis.title: Weathering of coal and lignite.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: By the period to be considered in this essay, Parliament had already become a more important, and in some respects, a very different institution from that which Edward I had intended to create. With the object of gaining national support for his plans, he had used his right of asking advice from anyone he pleased to call togather assemblies of nobles and elected representatives of the clergy and commons, to meet with his permanent council and discuss the affairs of the realm. [...]
thesis.creator: Wood-Legh, Kathleen L.
thesis.subject: History.
thesis.title: Parliament in the time of Chaucer.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
